briefdescription.para: Enable anti-aliasing for map rendering.
Enable drawing of vertex markers for layers in editing mode.
Vector graphics should not be cached and drawn as raster images.
Enable layer opacity and blending effects.
Enable drawing of labels on top of the map.
Enable vector simplification and other rendering optimizations.
Whether vector selections should be shown in the rendered map.
Draw bounds of symbols (for debugging/testing)
Draw map such that there are no problems between adjacent tiles.
Whether to make extra effort to update map image with partially rendered layers (better for interactive map canvas). Added in QGIS 3.0.
Render is a 'canvas preview' render, and shortcuts should be taken to ensure fast rendering.
Enumeration of flags that adjust the way the map is rendered.
ellipsoid acronym (from table tbl_ellipsoids)
list of layers to be rendered (stored as weak pointers)
Whether the actual settings are valid (set in updateDerived())
Extent with some additional white space that matches the output aspect ratio.
Gets the background color of the map.
Gets custom rendering flags.

detaileddescription.para:
Layers might honour these to alter their rendering.
custom flags strings, separated by ';'
setCustomRenderFlags()
QGIS 2.16

briefdescription.para: returns CRS of destination coordinate reference system
Returns the device output size of the map canvas This is equivalent to the output size multiplicated by the device pixel ratio.
Returns device pixel ratio Common values are 1 for normal-dpi displays and 2 for high-dpi "retina" displays.
Returns ellipsoid's acronym.

detaileddescription.para:
Calculations will only use the ellipsoid if a valid ellipsoid has been set.
setEllipsoid()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Gets the expression context.

detaileddescription.para:
This context should be used for all expression evaluation associated with this map settings.
setExpressionContext()
QGIS 2.12

briefdescription.para: Returns geographical coordinates of the rectangle that should be rendered.

detaileddescription.para: The actual visible extent used for rendering could be slightly different since the given extent may be expanded in order to fit the aspect ratio of output size. Use visibleExtent() to get the resulting extent.

briefdescription.para: Returns combination of flags used for rendering.
returns current extent of layer set
Check whether the map settings are valid and can be used for rendering.
Returns the list of regions to avoid placing labels within.
Returns the label boundary geometry, which restricts where in the rendered map labels are permitted to be placed.

detaileddescription.para: By default this is a null geometry, which indicates that labels can be placed anywhere within the map's visiblePolygon().
The geometry is specified using the map's destinationCrs().

briefdescription.para: Returns the global configuration of the labeling engine.
transform bounding box from layer's CRS to output CRS

simplesect.para: layerToMapCoordinates( const QgsMapLayer *, QgsRectangle ) const if you want to transform a rectangle
a bounding box (aligned rectangle) containing the transformed extent

briefdescription.para: Gets list of layer IDs for map rendering The layers are stored in the reverse order of how they are rendered (layer with index 0 will be on top)
Gets list of layers for map rendering The layers are stored in the reverse order of how they are rendered (layer with index 0 will be on top)
Gets map of map layer style overrides (key: layer ID, value: style name) where a different style should be used instead of the current one.
transform point coordinates from layer's CRS to output CRS
transform rectangle from layer's CRS to output CRS

simplesect.para: layerExtentToOutputExtent() if you want to transform a bounding box

briefdescription.para: Computes an estimated conversion factor between layer and map units: layerUnits * layerToMapUnits = mapUnits.

parameterdescription.para: A reference extent based on which to perform the computation. If not specified, the layer extent is used

briefdescription.para: Returns the coordinate transform from layer's CRS to destination CRS.

simplesect.para: transform - may be invalid if the transform is not needed

briefdescription.para: Returns the magnification factor.
transform point coordinates from output CRS to layer's CRS
transform rectangle from output CRS to layer's CRS

simplesect.para: outputExtentToLayerExtent() if you want to transform a bounding box

briefdescription.para: Gets units of map's geographical coordinates - used for scale calculation.
Returns the distance in geographical coordinates that equals to one pixel in the map.
Returns DPI used for conversion between real world units (e.g.

detaileddescription.para: mm) and pixels Default value is 96

briefdescription.para: transform bounding box from output CRS to layer's CRS

simplesect.para: mapToLayerCoordinates( const QgsMapLayer *, QgsRectangle ) const if you want to transform a rectangle
a bounding box (aligned rectangle) containing the transformed extent

briefdescription.para: format of internal QImage, default QImage::Format_ARGB32_Premultiplied
Returns the size of the resulting map image.
Returns the path resolver for conversion between relative and absolute paths during rendering operations, e.g.

detaileddescription.para: for resolving relative symbol paths.

briefdescription.para: Returns the rotation of the resulting map image, in degrees clockwise.
Returns the calculated map scale.

detaileddescription.para: The scale value indicates the scale denominator, e.g. 1000.0 for a 1:1000 map.

briefdescription.para: Gets the segmentation tolerance applied when rendering curved geometries.
Gets segmentation tolerance type (maximum angle or maximum difference between curve and approximation)
Gets color that is used for drawing of selected vector features.
Sets the background color of the map.
Sets the custom rendering flags.

detaileddescription.para:
Layers might honour these to alter their rendering.
customRenderFlags
custom flags strings, separated by ';'
customRenderFlags()
QGIS 2.16

briefdescription.para: sets destination coordinate reference system
Sets the device pixel ratio Common values are 1 for normal-dpi displays and 2 for high-dpi "retina" displays.
Sets the ellipsoid by its acronym.

detaileddescription.para:
Known ellipsoid acronyms can be retrieved using QgsEllipsoidUtils::acronyms(). Calculations will only use the ellipsoid if a valid ellipsoid has been set.
true if ellipsoid was successfully set
ellipsoid()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Sets the expression context.

detaileddescription.para:
This context is used for all expression evaluation associated with this map settings.
expressionContext()
QGIS 2.12

briefdescription.para: Set coordinates of the rectangle which should be rendered.

detaileddescription.para: The actual visible extent used for rendering could be slightly different since the given extent may be expanded in order to fit the aspect ratio of output size. Use visibleExtent() to get the resulting extent.

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable a particular flag (other flags are not affected)
Sets combination of flags that will be used for rendering.
Sets a list of regions to avoid placing labels within.
Sets the label boundary geometry, which restricts where in the rendered map labels are permitted to be placed.

detaileddescription.para: A null boundary geometry (the default) indicates that labels can be placed anywhere within the map's visiblePolygon().
The geometry is specified using the map's destinationCrs().

briefdescription.para: Sets the global configuration of the labeling engine.

simplesect.para: Calling this method will reset the textRenderFormat() to match the default text render format from the label engine settings.

briefdescription.para: Set list of layers for map rendering.

detaileddescription.para: The layers must be registered in QgsProject. The layers are stored in the reverse order of how they are rendered (layer with index 0 will be on top)

simplesect.para: Any non-spatial layers will be automatically stripped from the list (since they cannot be rendered!).

briefdescription.para: Set map of map layer style overrides (key: layer ID, value: style name) where a different style should be used instead of the current one.
Set the magnification factor.
Sets DPI used for conversion between real world units (e.g. mm) and pixels.
sets format of internal QImage
Sets the size of the resulting map image.
Sets the path resolver for conversion between relative and absolute paths during rendering operations, e.g.

detaileddescription.para: for resolving relative symbol paths.

briefdescription.para: Sets the rotation of the resulting map image, in degrees clockwise.
Sets the segmentation tolerance applied when rendering curved geometries.
Sets segmentation tolerance type (maximum angle or maximum difference between curve and approximation)
Sets color that is used for drawing of selected vector features.
Sets the text render format, which dictates how text is rendered (e.g.

detaileddescription.para: as paths or real text objects).

simplesect.para: Calling the setLabelingEngineSettings() method will reset the text render format to match the default text render format from the label engine settings.

briefdescription.para: Sets the coordinate transform context, which stores various information regarding which datum transforms should be used when transforming points from a source to destination coordinate reference system.
Check whether a particular flag is enabled.
Returns the text render format, which dictates how text is rendered (e.g.

detaileddescription.para: as paths or real text objects).

briefdescription.para: Returns the coordinate transform context, which stores various information regarding which datum transforms should be used when transforming points from a source to destination coordinate reference system.
Returns the actual extent derived from requested extent that takes takes output image size into account.
Returns the visible area as a polygon (may be rotated)
The QgsMapSettings class contains configuration for rendering of the map.

detaileddescription.para: The rendering itself is done by QgsMapRendererJob subclasses.
In order to set up QgsMapSettings instance, it is necessary to set at least few members: extent, output size and layers.

Some systems use high DPI scaling that is an alternative to the traditional DPI scaling. The operating system provides Qt with a scaling ratio and it scales window, event, and desktop geometry. The Cocoa platform plugin sets the scaling ratio as QWindow::devicePixelRatio(). To properly render the map on such systems, the map settings device pixel ratio shall be set accordingly.
